devdoc.author: iain nash Repository: https://github.com/ourzora/nft-serial-contracts/
devdoc.details: This allows creators to mint a series

constructor.details: Sets up the serial contract with a name, symbol, and an initial allowed creator.

params._allowedCreator: address allowed to create new Serials (aka Owner)
params.name: Name of NFT contract

createSerial(string,string,string,bytes3.details: Function to create a new serial. Can only be called by the allowed creator Sets the only allowed minter to the address that creates/owns the serial. This can be re-assigned or updated later

params.animationHash: The associated hash of the animation in sha-256 bytes32 format. If animation is omitted
params.animationUrl: Animation URL of the serial. Not required, but if omitted image URL needs to be included. This follows the opensea spec for NFTs
params.description: Description of serial, used in the description field of the NFT
params.imageHash: SHA256 of the given image in bytes32 format (0xHASH). If no image is included, the hash can be zero (bytes32 type)
params.imageUrl: Image URL of the serial. Strongly encouraged to be used, if necessary, only animation URL can be used. One of animation and image url need to exist in a serial to render the NFT.
params.name: Name of serial, used in the title as "$NAME NUMBER/TOTAL"
params.royaltyBPS: BPS of the royalty set on the contract. Can be 0 for no royalty.
params.royaltyRecipient: Recipient address of the royalty for resales
params.serialSize: Number of serials that can be minted in total.

creator(uint256).details: This retrieves the original owner/creator of the serial for a given tokenId

params.tokenId: token id to retrieve the owner for

mintSerial(uint256,address).details: This mints one serial to the given address by an allowed minter on the serial instance.

params.serialId: ID of the serial to mint
params.to: address to send the newly minted serial to

mintSerials(uint256,address[]).details: This mints multiple serials to the given list of addresses.

params.recipients: list of addresses to send the newly minted serials to
params.serialId: ID of the serial to mint

setAllowedCreator(address).details: This re-assigns the ethereum address that is allowed to create serials on this contract. To "freeze" a contract to prevent any more serials being created, this can be set to 0x0.

params.newCreator: address to re-assign the creator permission to

setAllowedMinters(uint256,address[]).details: Set the allowed minters array for a given serial id This requires that msg.sender is the owner of the given serial id.

params.allowedMinters: list of addresses allowed to mint this serial
params.serialId: serial to to update the minters for

setOwner(uint256,address).details: Reassigns the serial id to a new owners. Owners can update allowed minters and update URLs of a serial.

params.serialId: id of the serial to re-assign owner of

updateRoyaltyRecipient(uint256,address).details: Update the royalty recipient address Can only be called by the serial owner.

updateSerialURLs(uint256,string,string).details: Allows for updates of serial urls by the owner of the serial. Only URLs can be updated (data-uris are supported), hashes cannot be updated.

userdoc.notice: This is a smart contract for handling dynamic contract minting.
